page.title: 17Blacon Library
page.content: The library was built in 1968 and covers an area of 486 sq.m. It was well-stocked with books when new, but now there is a lack of money to fully replenish book stocks, provide more full-time trained staff or open more. Nevertheless, friendly staff strive to provide a library geared to the needs of the locality. Despite fewer books, the shelves do not look empty and uninviting - they have been altered to provide notice board or display space. Advice on everyday problems like tax and welfare benefits is available and local information. On Saturday mornings, local councillors hold a 'surgery' at the library. People are encouraged to read the wide range of newspapers and periodicals in the refernce room, or swap magazines. East chairs have been put in.Children may call in to play games like chess.
